text: The women's lightweight single sculls competition at the 2018 World Rowing Championships in Plovdiv took place at the Plovdiv Regatta Venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 9 September 2018 || 10:02 || Heats |- | Tuesday 11 September 2018 || 10:26 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Thursday 13 September 2018 || 11:00 || Semifinals A/B |- | 14:45 || Semifinals C/D |- | rowspan=4|Friday 14 September 2018 || style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:16 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |- | 15:19 || Final B |- | 15:35 || Final C |- | 15:51 || Final D |} All times are Eastern European Summer Time (UTC+3) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Jill Moffatt | Tarantola | align="left"| | 7:35.03 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Michelle Sechser | align="left"| | 7:36.38 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 7:42.59 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Khadija Krimi | align="left"| | 7:44.54 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:47.73 | R |} ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C/D semifinals. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Anastasia Lebedeva | align="left"| | 7:46.01 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Khadija Krimi | align="left"| | 7:46.98 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Anja Manoutschehri | align="left"| | 7:48.86 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Amina Rouba | align="left"| | 7:55.60 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Lee Ka Man | align="left"| | 8:05.19 | SC/D |- | – | align="left"|Emma Fredh | align="left"| | | – |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:39.84 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 7:43.68 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Olga Svirska | align="left"| | 7:47.88 | SC/D |- | 4 | align="left"|Iben Østergaard | align="left"| | 7:49.90 | SC/D |- | 5 | align="left"|Dorottya Bene | align="left"| | 7:55.25 | SC/D |- | 6 | align="left"|Ai Tsuchiya | align="left"| | 7:55.58 | SC/D |} ===Semifinals C/D=== All but the slowest boat in each semi were sent to the C final. The slowest boats were sent to the D final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Anja Manoutschehri | align="left"| | 7:59.20 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Iben Østergaard | align="left"| | 8:06.57 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Ai Tsuchiya | align="left"| | 8:12.11 | FC |- | 4 | align="left"|Lee Ka Man | align="left"| | 8:17.55 | FD |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Olga Svirska | align="left"| | 8:04.52 | FC |- | 2 | align="left"|Dorottya Bene | align="left"| | 8:05.26 | FC |- | 3 | align="left"|Amina Rouba | align="left"| | 8:10.36 | FD |} ===Semifinals A/B=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Imogen Grant | align="left"| | 7:43.01 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Michelle Sechser | align="left"| | 7:44.84 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Jill Moffatt | align="left"| | 7:45.85 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Katarzyna Welna | align="left"| | 7:52.07 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 8:00.82 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Anastasia Lebedeva | align="left"| | 8:05.20 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Alena Furman | align="left"| | 7:43.34 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Laura Tarantola | align="left"| | 7:43.41 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Clara Guerra | align="left"| | 7:44.02 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:50.13 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 7:50.99 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Khadija Krimi | align="left"| | 8:00.07 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final D==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Amina Rouba | align="left"| | 8:12.53 |- | 2 | align="left"|Lee Ka Man | align="left"| | 8:19.61 |} ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Anja Manoutschehri | align="left"| | 7:55.39 |- | 2 | align="left"|Olga Svirska | align="left"| | 8:00.70 |- | 3 | align="left"|Iben Østergaard | align="left"| | 8:05.17 |- | 4 | align="left"|Dorottya Bene | align="left"| | 8:08.28 |- | 5 | align="left"|Ai Tsuchiya | align="left"| | 8:09.45 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 7:52.27 |- | 2 | align="left"|Katarzyna Welna | align="left"| | 7:52.37 |- | 3 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:56.11 |- | 4 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 7:56.25 |- | 5 | align="left"|Khadija Krimi | align="left"| | 7:57.66 |- | 6 | align="left"|Anastasia Lebedeva | align="left"| | 8:03.93 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Laura Tarantola | align="left"| | 7:51.79 |- | | align="left"|Clara Guerra | align="left"| | 7:51.96 |- | | align="left"|Imogen Grant | align="left"| | 7:52.61 |- | 4 | align="left"|Michelle Sechser | align="left"| | 7:53.70 |- | 5 | align="left"|Jill Moffatt | align="left"| | 8:02.39 |- | 6 | align="left"|Alena Furman | align="left"| | 13:30.77 |} ==References== Category:2018 World Rowing Championships World
title: 2018 World Rowing Championships – Women's lightweight single sculls
